result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon Kevin Crisp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gordon Kevin Crisp in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with 4 days credit for time served, with huber for work.  COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
-Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
--Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Mental health evaluation and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Counseling deemed necessary by the department and comply with any treatment.
-No contact with Kim C. 
-Restitution is set at $0. 
-Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 8-24-2015 or civil judgment. 

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

case called at 10:11
Statements by Dawn S. Bail motion to modify no contact order by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Gordon Kevin Crisp in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kim C and  his address; Gary C 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gordon Kevin Crisp in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Gordon Kevin Crisp in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered complaint amended.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
